snippet: The White House tried to channel the rage over events in Missouri into a national debate about how to restore trust between the police and the public.
abstract: Obama administration will tighten standards on provision of military-style equipment to law enforcement departments across nation and on training for use of such gear; move is part of effort to channel anger over fatal police shooting of black teenager Michael Brown into national debate aimed at rebuilding trust between public and police.

byline.contributor: Matt Apuzzo contributed reporting from Washington, and Richard Fausset from Atlanta.

lead_paragraph: The White House tried to channel the rage over events in Missouri into a national debate about how to restore trust between the police and the public.

headline.main: Obama Offers New Standards on Police Gear in Wake of Ferguson Protests
headline.print_headline: Obama Offers New Standards on Police Gear
